Welcome to Middleearth! This book will show you how to use the basic things in this country.
This book updates itself if something changed. Keep it with you.

The high elvens are known for making great swords. Their smiths could create sharp blades.
Crafted on Lindon Crafting table.
Alloys: - Elven Steel(Liquified Coal[1] + Molten Iron[1])

The dwarvens are known for their great blacksmithing. They use furnaces hotter than any other.
Abilitys: Smelts a bit faster and hotter, so it could smelt mithril ore more efficently. Crafted on Dwarven Crafting table.
Alloys: - Dwarven Steel(Liquified Coal[1] + Molten Iron[1]) - Galvorn(Molten Edhelmir[1] + Molten Iron[1]) - Blue Dwarven Steel(Molten Sarlluin[2] + Molten Iron[1])

Angmar, the fallen realm of the witch-king.
Abilitys: Smelts morgul iron ore more efficently. Crafted on Angmar Crafting table.
Alloys: - Uruk Steel(Liquified Coal[1] + Molten Iron[1]) - Black Uruk Steel(Molten Orc Steel[1] + Molten Durnaur[1]) - Morgul Steel(Molten Orc Steel[1] + Molten Gulduril[1])

There are other blocks for the new smelterys: bricks and tanks. They are crafted like the normal ones, but on other craftig tables.
High Elven blocks: Lindon Crafting table Dwarven blocks: Dwarven Crafting table Angmar blocks: Angmar Crafting table
There are also new materials. This book could be crafted into an new book with a full list of these.
